ETYMOLOGY: From Anglo-Norman roialté, from Old French roialté, equivalent to royal + -ty. First attested in English in the late 13th century.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The status, power, or dignity of a king, queen, or other sovereign; members of a royal family collectively.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 王权；王位；（总称）王室成员，皇族。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The documentary provided a rare look into the lives of European royalty.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这部纪录片罕见地揭示了欧洲王室成员的生活。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A percentage of the revenue from the sale or performance of a work or product, paid to the author, inventor, or owner of the intellectual property.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 版税；专利使用费；特许权使用费。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The musician earned substantial royalties from streaming services.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位音乐家从流媒体服务中获得了可观的版税收入。
